sections.purpose: To cut and reduce the size of fibrous or hard plant materials into smaller particles.
sections.scope: Applicable to size reduction of roots, barks, and stems prior to grinding in Pharmacognosy.
procedure: Inspect the mill chamber, knives, and screen for cleanliness and integrity.
Set the desired screen size according to the required particle size.
Feed the dried plant material gradually into the hopper while the cutter is running.
Collect the cut material from the outlet container.
Switch OFF the mill and allow the blades to come to a complete stop before opening the chamber.
Brush out any remaining material and clean the chamber, knives, and screen.
precautions: Do not insert hands or tools into the hopper while the mill is operating.
Ensure material is adequately dried to prevent clogging.
Wear hearing protection if noise levels are high.
Check knives regularly for sharpness and damage and replace when needed.
Securely fasten all covers and safety interlocks before starting the mill.
